meanings.definition: A man of high social standing who attends a knight.
meanings.sent1: The squire assisted the knight during his battles.
meanings.sent2: The squire rode alongside the knight on his noble steed.
meanings.sent3: The squire comically tried to joust with a broomstick.
meanings.sent4: She was the squire of the office, always helping out her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The squire's loyalty to the knight was unwavering.

meanings.definition: To escort or attend to someone in a chivalrous manner.
meanings.sent1: He would squire the lady to the ball with great care.
meanings.sent2: The gentleman squired the lady through the crowded streets.
meanings.sent3: The waiter squired the customer to their table with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: She squired her grandmother around the garden, holding her arm gently.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog squired the child safely across the busy street.
